What is the purpose of the Hedera Consensus Service (HCS) mirror node?

The purpose of the Hedera Consensus Service (HCS) mirror node is to provide a gRPC API endpoint for streaming HCS messages. It allows developers to subscribe to HCS topics and receive messages for the topics they are interested in.

What are the recommended SDK versions that support TLS for the mainnet mirror node?
The recommended SDK versions that support TLS for the mainnet mirror node are: Java v2.0.6+, JavaScript v2.0.23+, and Go v2.1.9+.

Is authentication required for accessing the mirror nodes?
At this time, no authentication is required to access the mirror nodes.

How many requests per second (rps) are throttled for the mirror nodes?
Requests are throttled at 100 requests per second (rps), but this may change in the future depending on performance or security considerations.

What is the mainnet mirror node endpoint for the gRPC API?
The mainnet mirror node endpoint for the gRPC API is mainnet-public.mirrornode.hedera.com:443

Where can developers access the testnet mirror node and its transaction data?

Developers can access the testnet mirror node and its transaction data at the following endpoints: HCS Testnet Mirror Node Endpoint: testnet.mirrornode.hedera.com:443 and REST API Testnet Root Endpoint: https://testnet.mirrornode.hedera.com

What does the previewnet mirror node contain, and how can developers access it?

The previewnet mirror node contains previewnet transaction data. Developers can access the previewnet mirror node at the following endpoints: HCS Previewnet Mirror Node Endpoint: previewnet.mirrornode.hedera.com:443 and REST API Preview Testnet Root Endpoint: https://previewnet.mirrornode.hedera.com
